name: Cherry Springs State Park Rustic Campground
note: Cherry Springs State Park is nearly as remote and wild today as it was two centuries ago. Its dark skies make it a haven for astronomers. Due to its exceptionally dark skies, Cherry Springs State Park is one of the best places on the eastern seaboard for stargazing and the science of astronomy

name: Watchman Campground
note:
Nestled at the base of the iconic Watchman Peak, this campground offers dramatic views of red sandstone cliffs and the Virgin River. The towering formations create a breathtaking backdrop, especially at sunrise or sunset.
Zion National Park campground with sites in loops A and B directly adjacent to the Virgin River.

name: North Rim Campground
note:
Perched on the quieter, less-visited North Rim, this campground provides jaw-dropping vistas of the Grand Canyons vast expanse. The elevation and remoteness enhance the sweeping views of the canyons layered cliffs.
High-elevation campground on the Grand Canyon's North Rim; no water bodies at this location.

name: Silver Bell
note: Located near Aspen, this campground frames the iconic Maroon Bellstwin peaks rising above Maroon Lake. The rugged Elk Mountains and golden aspens in fall make it a postcard-worthy spot.  Not lakefront.

name: Kirk Creek Campground
note:
Perched above the Pacific Ocean along the rugged Big Sur coast, this spot offers panoramic views of waves crashing against cliffs. The sunrise over the water is a highlight, with trails leading to redwoods and waterfalls nearby.
Sites on a bluff directly overlooking the Pacific Ocean on the Big Sur coast with no barriers between sites and the coastline.

name: Many Glacier Campground
note: Stunning views of Glacier's iconic mountains.  Several campsites are right on the creek.  A lake is nearby.

name: Tuolumne Meadows Campground
note:
High in the Sierra Nevada, this campground features sweeping views of granite domes, meadows, and waterfalls. The open landscape showcases Yosemites alpine splendor, especially with wildflowers in summer.
Yosemite campground with sites along the Tuolumne River and Dana Fork.

name: Kalaloch Campground
note:
Overlooking the Pacific Ocean, this campground provides dramatic coastal views from bluff-top sites. Driftwood-strewn beaches and the sound of crashing waves make it a striking spot year-round.
Olympic National Park campground with bluff-top sites directly on the Pacific coastline with beach access below.

name: Bartlett Cove Campground
note:
Tucked along the shores of Glacier Bay, this remote site offers views of icy waters, dense forests, and distant snow-capped peaks. Kayaking reveals even more of the areas wild beauty.
Walk-in tent sites along the shore of Bartlett Cove in Glacier Bay National Park.

name: Kayenta Campground
note:
Just outside Arches and Canyonlands, this campground overlooks the Colorado Rivers dramatic 2,000-foot cliffs. The sunrise casts a fiery glow over the desert landscape, rivaling the Grand Canyon in grandeur.
Campground on a mesa top far above the Colorado River; not at river level.

name: Juniper Springs Campground
note:
Amid Floridas subtropical wilderness, this campground offers views of crystal-clear springs and ancient cypress trees. The lush greenery and water reflections create a tranquil, unique vista.
Ocala National Forest campground with sites adjacent to the crystal-clear Juniper Springs Run.

name: Houchin Ferry Campground
note:
Along the Green River, this site provides scenic river views framed by limestone bluffs and hardwood forests. The rolling hills hint at the vast cave system below.
NPS campground in Mammoth Cave National Park with sites directly along the Green River.

name: Savanna Portage State Park Campground
note:
East of the Mississippi in northern Minnesota, this campground overlooks shimmering lakes surrounded by dense woods. The peaceful water views and vibrant autumn colors stand out.
Campground with lakefront sites on Savanna Lake.

name: Davidson River Campground
note:
Near the Blue Ridge Parkway, this campground features views of rugged Appalachian peaks and cascading waterfalls like Looking Glass Falls. The dense forest adds depth to the landscape.
USFS campground in Pisgah National Forest with riverside sites directly along the Davidson River.

name: Elkmont Campground

Surrounded by misty ridges and lush forests, this site delivers breathtaking views of the Smokies rolling peaks. The elevation and vibrant fall foliage amplify the scenery.
